navigators.smart.tom

Class ServiceReplica

  • java.lang.Object
    • navigators.smart.tom.ServiceReplica
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TOMReceiver

    public class ServiceReplica
extends java.lang.Object
implements TOMReceiver
    This class implements a TOMReceiver, and also a replica for the server side of the application. It receives requests from the clients, runs a TOM layer, and sends a reply back to the client Applications must create a class that extends this one, and implement the executeOrdered method

      • receiveMessages

        public void receiveMessages(int consId,
                   int regency,
                   boolean fromConsensus,
                   TOMMessage[] requests)
        Description copied from interface: TOMReceiver
        This is the method invoked by the DeliveryThread to deliver a batch of messages to the receiver. If the receiver implements the BatchExcetutable interface, the messages are delivered as a bath. Otherwise, messages are delivered one by one.
        Specified by:
        receiveMessages in interface TOMReceiver
        Parameters:
        consId - The id of the consensus in which the messages were ordered.
        regency - Regency in which the message was delivered * @param fromConsensus Set to true if this message was delivered through consensus, * false if through the state transfer protocol
        requests - The batch with TOMMessage objects.

      • leave

        public void leave()
        This method makes the replica leave the group

      • getState

        public byte[] getState()
        Description copied from interface: TOMReceiver
        This method is used by the TOM Layer to retrieve the state of the application. This must be implemented by the programmer, and it should retrieve an array of bytes that contains the application state.
        Specified by:
        getState in interface TOMReceiver
        Returns:
        An array of bytes that can be diserialized into the application state

      • setState

        public void setState(byte[] state)
        Description copied from interface: TOMReceiver
        This method is invoked by the TOM Layer in order to ser a state upon the aplication. This is done when a replica is delayed compared to the rest of the group, and when it recovers after a failure.
        Specified by:
        setState in interface TOMReceiver
        Parameters:
        state - a byte array that is the serialization of the application's state

      • getReplicaContext

        public final ReplicaContext getReplicaContext()
        Obtains the current replica context (getting access to several information and capabilities of the replication engine).
        Returns:
        this replica context
